meanings.definition: To insert or establish something firmly within something else.
meanings.sent1: She was ingrafting the new idea into her mind.
meanings.sent2: The gardener was ingrafting a new branch onto the tree.
meanings.sent3: The chef was ingrafting extra flavor into the dish.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was ingrafting knowledge into the students' minds.
meanings.sent5: The artist was ingrafting colors onto the canvas.

meanings.definition: The act of incorporating or adding something into something else.
meanings.sent1: The ingrafting of new technology into the company's system was successful.
meanings.sent2: She studied the ingrafting of foreign words into the language.
meanings.sent3: The ingrafting of humor into the speech made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The ingrafting of traditions into the family brought them closer together.
meanings.sent5: The ingrafting of creativity into the project made it stand out.
